answer: A: To form a dome on top rather than a sagging "dish," establishing the frame before the side poles go in.

The demonstrator explains that the crisscross pattern of the roof poles is used to create a dome shape on top of the tent, which prevents it from sagging like a dish. This is done before the side poles are installed to establish the overall structure of the tent.
